values.value: GDPR Article 33 requires organizations to notify the supervisory authority of a personal data breach within 72 hours of becoming aware of it. Article 34 requires notification to affected data subjects without undue delay if the breach poses a high risk to their rights and freedoms.
GDPR Article 33 - Notification of a Personal Data Breach to the Supervisory Authority, Article 34 - Communication of a Personal Data Breach to the Data Subject

1. Enable comprehensive audit logging to detect potential data breaches (Field History, Setup Audit Trail, Event Monitoring). 2. Implement automated alerts for suspicious access patterns (bulk data exports, unauthorized access attempts). 3. Document breach notification procedures and assign breach response team. 4. Maintain incident log with timestamps, affected data subjects, and breach details. 5. Test breach notification procedures quarterly. 6. Ensure breach notifications include required information (nature of breach, categories of data, number of data subjects affected, likely consequences, measures taken).
